pros: Amazing department of volunteering in comparison to other NYP hospitals.
cons: No cons for volunteers. You meet nice healthcare professionals who keep you motivated.

job_title: Registered Nurse in New York, NY
pros: Good pay, decent benefits, decent hours
cons: Very poor management, understaffed, rarely approve PTO

pros: Good salary, great health insurance
cons: Poor staffing, sometimes really high number of patients per nurse

job_title: Environmental Service Worker in Brooklyn, NY
pros: Paid time off, paid sick leave, paid vacation
cons: Bad managers, overworked, way too strict

review_title: It's like life, one must take the good with the bad....
pros: Opportunity to learn a lot in the department of Radiology. Radiologists are very good for the most part.  They are, on a whole respectful of support staff and technologists.
cons: No loyalty among non-physician staff, which among other factors has a negative impact on employee morale.    If you are friendly with the payroll processor its easy to get a few unearned hours added to your paycheck.  Very clickish environment.  Middle management has limited authority so you are basically on your own and at the mercy of the wolves. Lots of backstabbing.   Do your job well, keep your head low and more than anything, don't trust anyone.  Good for your resume, but if you are not directly involved with patient care, just give it a couple of years and move on.

pros: The facility is beautiful, flexible with schedules, great pay, and the staff is very helpful. Most people I encountered were very much conducive to my learning and genuinely concerned in the care that they gave. It is definitely a hospital you commit to long term. It is located in the Park Slope neighborhood that has beautiful sights, and provides a great atmosphere.
cons: As with any hospital and field, it is competitive and keeping your job is something you must prove you're worthy of. However, I was let go mid-orientation for something that wasn't detrimental to anyone's health and could've been corrected in a short amount of time. Although they were not wrong in doing so, the process in which they went about it could've been handled better.

review_title: DO NOT WORK HERE THEY ARE BIAS !!!!!!!!!!!
pros: there is no pros to work at this institution
cons:
High school pettiness and backstabbing abound. Patients complain about the rude staff. Too many lazy slow people counting the days until their retirement. High quality people who actually care about improving things are seen as a threat and laid off. It doesn't take long for staff to realize how conniving and sneaky management can be. It makes you question what are you doing wrong despite the fact you aren't doing anything wrong. The atmosphere is filled with negative energy and If you express any of the frustrations you have, (to which nothing will be done about by rude and incompetent HR & Union personnel), working here is like being a legal slave and they enjoy  lynching the employees.  Don’t be fooled a lot of corruption taking place in a prestige name such as New York Presbyterian, it is a bureaucratic organization. 

RUN AWAY!

review_title: Can be a great place to work
pros:
Friendly staff-get to know the people you work with since you interact with them on a daily baisis
Each floor has a mangarer to support the staff
Methodist has some outstanding departamental leaders who go above and beyond for their employees.
cons:
Some of the units are understaffed-too many patients per nurse
Nurses are overworked

pros: they have ok pay ...boss not in the same building as me.there is nothing more that is so great about methodist ...look carelfully..I am not happy about writing so many pro about a hospital that dont have it together.
cons: high premiums, no pay raises.... people doing the job they were not hired for. they need to look at 1199 employees being treated poorly...awful management promotions is a no ... healthcare sucks ...alot of reorganizing that is taking forever.

review_title: UNFAIR BIAS poor communication/attitude throughout dept
job_title: Patient Financial Services in Brooklyn, NY
pros: They will over pay you so you accept position be aware! If I had chance to do it again I would not have accepted!
cons: Working for patient accounts they are very clicky... They have hand full of people they really like and people stick together no matter how much experience you have or even if you different views or direction.  They have very poor support systems in place. I would not recommend anyone working there. New management in my opinion they do not have the right core values and is not leading correctly. Everything is flying under radar a lot of uncovered layers of issues not properly addressed. Also the way areas are structured and ran does not make sense and is not efficient in maximizing optimization.

pros: Good salary and benefits.  Nice location in Park Slope.  Right  by the F train and easy to get to by train.  Great places to go to during your lunch break.  Nice people to work with.
cons: Some favoritism toward certain employees.  Limited opportunities to grow professionally unless you are studying to become a nurse or medical health worker.

review_title: Employees yearn for management  to recognize the need and importance for enhancing communication interdepartmentally.
pros: Hospital continually strives to be on the front-line for new and innovative treatment for its patients
cons: Sharing information and communication between departments needs to be greatly improved. Supervisors share knowledge in limited amounts - seemingly for fear of being replaced.

pros: The benefits package is great in terms of PTO (4 weeks). There are also a good amount of young professionals who are all very nice and fun. My job itself was good but not great.
cons: Not as much growth opportunity available to staff outside of medical positions; some managers are more helpful and approachable than others

pros: Great benefits, including health, dental, vision, 401k, tuition reimbursement after 6 months of employment (up to $8500/year).  Eligible for discounts include cellular phone services, tickets to museums, theme parks, Broadway shows, movie theater tickets, gym memberships, restaurants etc.
cons: Since it's MSO of Kings County (affiliated with New York Methodist Hospital) pay rate is different. You get paid more if you are hired directly by the hospital, or so I have been told. You get Union benefits with the hospital (1199). MSO of Kings County does not.

job_title: Staff/Charge Nurse Labor in Brooklyn, NY
pros: Close to home and the pay is ok for a Brooklyn based facility
cons: Doctors are disrespectful to nursing staff. Nurses do not have autonomy. Management isn't pro nursing and don't appreciate the hard work staff display. Always have unsafe staffing issues without a resolution

review_title: Horrible Employer, shady Human resource personnel
pros: hospital insurance, tuition reimbursement, paid vacation, paid sick days
cons: terrible human resource personnel, they hire you for one position and expects you to do the work of three other position and when you do get paid it is for less than the agreed salary.. and when asked about said salary they just say they made a mistake and expect you to be okay with it.

pros:
Salary
Aesthetics
Supportive supervisors and staff. 
Generous orientation time period.
cons:
High nurse patient ratio.
Heavily documentation and penalty centered environment.
Low concern for nurses needs.

pros: Picked up many administrative management skills in a high demand, busy environment. Had the pleasure to work with some awesome healthcare providers, who were always willing to share pointers about a career in healthcare.
cons: Lots of tension between workers- no transparency between co workers. Very busy and some unreasonable demands from some staff but not others.

pros: great nursing staff and co-workers
cons: management not nice, treat nurses as enemies, a lot of disrespect from management, doctors and patients, most of the time overwhelmed, understaffed... there is a lot to say.....

job_title: Emergency Department RN in Brooklyn, NY
pros: 12 hour shifts, great benefits & interacting with patients and seeing there progress & recover
cons: Most hospitals are understaffed, Thr patient to nurse ratio was 20/25 to 1

pros: Flexible schedule. If management favors you you will be ok.
cons: No room for growth, management is extremely unprofessional and takes business matters personal. The HR dept needs to be revamped issues that are brought to them are not handled appropriately.

pros: You can  start your career at this  institution .
cons: Everything is punitive  .  Staff Morale is at its lowest, Therefor  you feel de-valued.

pros: A great environment for any students aspiring to be in the healthcare field to learn and experience first-hand the world of medicine.
cons: Nothing bad about the institution. Cannot really comment on management or pay, since my position was as an intern.

review_title: It was great to do something worthwhile while in school.
pros:
Friendly folks and great smiles all around
Great advancements
Quality environment
cons:

pros: Staff and Drs are great to work with. Hours are comfortable .
cons: Very busy office. Patients can be very difficult at times, especially if having to wait.

pros: I love my jobs and my pts and I respect my and I'm always on time barely late for work. I'm a very trustworthy.
cons: Very good hospital and b environment to work great drs. And wonderful pts all day long.

pros: The staff in the Emergency Medicine department were very understanding. Training was efficient and a lot of my creativity was excepted.
cons: Not so good benefits, but I worked thru an agency so the hospital might be different.

pros: Yearly raises,  and  other coworkers.
cons: The Credo states the employer has respect and empathy to employees. To value the input of staff. Don’t believe it!! It’s all a facade.

pros: Clean environment, nurses take pride in work
cons: No parking for day shift or high prices for garage, management Does not advocate for employees at times, feel too micro-managed

pros:
Staff members work together to achieve amazing things. 
Patient population diverse.

cons:
Very little down time. 
Can be very stressfull

pros: Very good company to work if you are planing
cons: I think so it is one of the best company so i can not write any thing which goes against it

pros: The nurses work as a team unit.
cons: The nurse administration does not support its nursing staff.

pros: Friendly enviroment. Plesant working conditons. Would return to work there if a postion was open.
